intro: Mammillaria centricirrha f. lactescens, commonly known as the white-furred mammillaria, is a compact cactus with a globular shape and a dense covering of white, woolly bristles. It originates from the arid regions of Mexico, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The plant features prominent radial spines and a short, thick stem that stores water efficiently. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and cactus collections. Due to its slow growth and specific care requirements, it is considered a challenging but rewarding plant for experienced growers.
